name: Accuracy (TEA-DT Natural Environment Workshop)
description: A partial assurance case to use as a template for the TEA-DT workshop.

goals.name: G1
goals.short_description: The digital twin provides sufficiently accurate representations across all operational use cases.

strategies.name: S1
strategies.short_description: Argument Over Data Sources and Integration
strategies.long_description: Argument Over Data Sources and Integration

property_claims.name: P1
property_claims.short_description: The data used by the digital twin has sufficient quality.
property_claims.long_description: The data used by the digital twin has sufficient quality.

property_claims.name: P1.1
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin uses data from reliable sources.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin uses data from reliable sources.

property_claims.name: P1.1.1
property_claims.short_description: {Information source 1} produces reliable data.
property_claims.long_description: {Information source 1} produces reliable data.

property_claims.name: P1.1.2
property_claims.short_description: {Information source N} produces reliable data.
property_claims.long_description: {Information source N} produces reliable data.

property_claims.name: P1.2
property_claims.short_description: The data used by the digital twin are sufficiently complete.
property_claims.long_description: The data used by the digital twin are sufficiently complete.

property_claims.name: P1.2.1
property_claims.short_description: Imputation method for dealing with missingness is appropriate.
property_claims.long_description: Imputation method for dealing with missingness is appropriate.

property_claims.name: P1.2.2
property_claims.short_description: Regular audits are conducted to ensure data completeness.
property_claims.long_description: Regular audits are conducted to ensure data completeness.

property_claims.name: P1.3
property_claims.short_description: The data used by the digital twin are unique.
property_claims.long_description: The data used by the digital twin are unique.

property_claims.name: P1.3.1
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin has mechanisms to detect and prevent data redundancy.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin has mechanisms to detect and prevent data redundancy.

property_claims.name: P1.4
property_claims.short_description: The data used by the digital twin have sufficient timeliness.
property_claims.long_description: The data used by the digital twin have sufficient timeliness.

property_claims.name: P1.4.1
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin gathers data in { real-time / near real-time / just-in-time}.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin gathers data in { real-time / near real-time / just-in-time}.

property_claims.name: P1.5
property_claims.short_description: The data used by the digital twin are consistent.
property_claims.long_description: The data used by the digital twin are consistent.

property_claims.name: P1.5.1
property_claims.short_description: Data is standardised across all systems and sources used by the digital twin.
property_claims.long_description: Data is standardised across all systems and sources used by the digital twin.

property_claims.name: P1.6
property_claims.short_description: The data used by the digital twin are valid.
property_claims.long_description: The data used by the digital twin are valid.

property_claims.name: P1.6.1
property_claims.short_description: Data conforms to predefined rules, formats, and standards.
property_claims.long_description: Data conforms to predefined rules, formats, and standards.

property_claims.name: P1.6.2
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin only accepts data that meets validity criteria.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin only accepts data that meets validity criteria.

property_claims.name: P2
property_claims.short_description: Data integration methods are appropriate for the context of use.
property_claims.long_description: Data integration methods are appropriate for the context of use.

property_claims.name: P2.1
property_claims.short_description: Data normalisation methods remove undesirable redundancy.
property_claims.long_description: Data normalisation methods remove undesirable redundancy.

property_claims.name: P2.2
property_claims.short_description: Data harmonisaton methods use suitable conversion standards or ontologies.
property_claims.long_description: Data harmonisaton methods use suitable conversion standards or ontologies.

property_claims.name: P3
property_claims.short_description: Information about the data pipeline is suitably communicated.
property_claims.long_description: Information about the data pipeline is suitably communicated.

property_claims.name: P3.1
property_claims.short_description: Technical documentation about the data pipeline is complete and accurate.
property_claims.long_description: Technical documentation about the data pipeline is complete and accurate.

property_claims.name: P3.2
property_claims.short_description: Technical documentation about the data pipeline is accessible to all relevant parties.
property_claims.long_description: Technical documentation about the data pipeline is accessible to all relevant parties.

property_claims.name: P4
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin has sufficient utility in all intended use cases.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin has sufficient utility in all intended use cases.

property_claims.name: P4.1
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin has sufficient utility in {use case 1}.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin has sufficient utility in {use case 1}.

property_claims.name: P4.1.1
property_claims.short_description: The features used by the system are suitable for the physical system being modelled.
property_claims.long_description: The features used by the system are suitable for the physical system being modelled.

property_claims.name: P4.1.2
property_claims.short_description: The functional outputs of the digital twin enable actionable insights.
property_claims.long_description: The functional outputs of the digital twin enable actionable insights.

property_claims.name: P4.1.3
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin has sufficient utility in all intended operational conditions.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin has sufficient utility in all intended operational conditions.

property_claims.name: P4.1.3.1
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin provides accurate representations under normal conditions.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin provides accurate representations under normal conditions.

property_claims.name: P4.1.3.2
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin provides accurate representations under extreme conditions.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin provides accurate representations under extreme conditions.

property_claims.name: P4.1.3.3
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin provides accurate representations under transitional conditions (e.g., changing seasons).
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin provides accurate representations under transitional conditions (e.g., changing seasons).

property_claims.name: P4.1.4
property_claims.short_description: The purpose of the system has been clearly formulated and documented.
property_claims.long_description: The purpose of the system has been clearly formulated and documented.

property_claims.name: P4.1.4.1
property_claims.short_description: All intended operational conditions have been specified.
property_claims.long_description: All intended operational conditions have been specified.

property_claims.name: P4.1.4.2
property_claims.short_description: Limitations of the system have been clearly communicated.
property_claims.long_description: Limitations of the system have been clearly communicated.

property_claims.name: P4.2
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin has sufficient utility in {use case N}.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin has sufficient utility in {use case N}.

property_claims.name: P5
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin's performance has been sufficiently verified.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin's performance has been sufficiently verified.

property_claims.name: P5.1
property_claims.short_description: All performance requirements or thresholds have been met or exceeded.
property_claims.long_description: All performance requirements or thresholds have been met or exceeded.

property_claims.name: P5.2
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin meets the agreed upon specifications.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin meets the agreed upon specifications.

property_claims.name: P6
property_claims.short_description: The performance of the digital twin is robust.
property_claims.long_description: The performance of the digital twin is robust.

property_claims.name: P6.1
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin has been externally validated in an environment that is not sufficiently varied from the environment represented within the training data.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin has been externally validated in an environment that is not sufficiently varied from the environment represented within the training data.

property_claims.name: P7
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin has sufficient performance against external benchmarks.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin has sufficient performance against external benchmarks.

property_claims.name: P8
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin's usability has been sufficiently validated.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin's usability has been sufficiently validated.

property_claims.name: P8.1
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin's usability has been independently validated through expert reviews and feedback.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin's usability has been independently validated through expert reviews and feedback.

property_claims.name: P8.2
property_claims.short_description: The digital twin's usability meets design specifications.
property_claims.long_description: The digital twin's usability meets design specifications.

property_claims.name: P9
property_claims.short_description: All biases have been proportionately mitigated.
property_claims.long_description: All biases have been proportionately mitigated.

property_claims.name: P9.1
property_claims.short_description: All relevant biases have been identified.
property_claims.long_description: All relevant biases have been identified.

property_claims.name: P9.2
property_claims.short_description: Bias mitigation techniques are sufficient for identified risks.
property_claims.long_description: Bias mitigation techniques are sufficient for identified risks.

property_claims.name: P9.2.1
property_claims.short_description: {Bias mitigation technique N} is sufficient for  {risk N}.
property_claims.long_description: {Bias mitigation technique N} is sufficient for  {risk N}.

property_claims.name: P10
property_claims.short_description: Unintended consequences caused by digital twin are unlikely.
property_claims.long_description: Unintended consequences caused by digital twin are unlikely.

property_claims.name: P10.1
property_claims.short_description: Ongoing monitoring has been established to detected undesirable model drift.
property_claims.long_description: Ongoing monitoring has been established to detected undesirable model drift.

property_claims.name: P10.2
property_claims.short_description: Feedback mechanisms have been established to enable users to log errors or issues.
property_claims.long_description: Feedback mechanisms have been established to enable users to log errors or issues.
